name: Mengtxia.GitHub.io
body:
### Welcome to Mengtxia's GitHub.
This is a collection of some of my work here.automatic page generator is the easiest way to create beautiful pages for all of your projects. Author your page content here [using GitHub Flavored Markdown](https://guides.github.com/features/mastering-markdown/), select a template crafted by a designer, and publish. After your page is generated, you can check out the new `gh-pages` branch locally. If you’re using GitHub Desktop, simply sync your repository and you’ll see the new branch.

### Mengtxia in Finance
We’ve crafted some handsome templates for you to use. Go ahead and click 'Continue to layouts' to browse through them. You can easily go back to edit your page before publishing. After publishing your page, you can revisit the page generator and switch to another theme. Your Page content will be preserved.

### Python projects

* [Basics](https://github.com/mengtxia/mengtxia.github.io/blob/master/python-basics-notebook-empty.ipynb)
* [Secrets](https://github.com/mengtxia/mengtxia.github.io/blob/master/python-secret-notebook-empty.ipynb)


### Papers
* research on structure on Spiking Network
* research estimation of If you prefer to not use the automatic generator, push a branch named `gh-pages` to your repository to create a page manually. In addition to supporting regular HTML content, GitHub Pages support Jekyll, a simple, blog aware static site generator. Jekyll makes it easy to create site-wide headers and footers without having to copy them across every page. It also offers intelligent blog support and other advanced templating features.

### Mengting Xia's resume
You can click the link below to have a look at my resume.
[resume](http://mengtxia.github.io/MengtXia.pdf)
You can @mention a GitHub username to generate a link to their profile. The resulting `<a>` element will link to the contributor’s GitHub Profile. For example: In 2007, Chris Wanstrath (@defunkt), PJ Hyett (@pjhyett), and Tom Preston-Werner (@mojombo) founded GitHub.

### About me
I am a grad student at the University of Michigan, in the [Quantitative Finance and Risk Management]
(https://lsa.umich.edu/math/graduates/quantitative-finance.html)program. I did my undergraduate work in Magical or [contact support](https://github.com/contact) and we’ll help you sort it out.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
